header.gameNote: COLL OF CHARLESTON STATE FARM SH

article.headline: Bucknell 68, Norfolk State 52
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Kevin Bettencourt scored a game-high 29 points as Bucknell defeated Norfolk State 68-52 in Monday's opening game of the 2003 Saturn of North Charleston Shootout. The Bison (3-6) advance to the championship game of the tournament Tuesday against the winner of Monday's Long Island-College of Charleston game. Bettencourt was 9-for-9 from the foul line and 8-for-18 from the field including four 3-pointers. Chakowby Hicks kept the Spartans in the game tying a career-high 27 points. Derrick Smith added nine points for Norfolk State (1-8). The Bison scored the first 11 points of the game. Bettencourt led the Bison charge in the first half with 19 points. Bettencourt's two free throws with 0.7 seconds left in the half gave the Bucknell its largest lead of the game at 16 at 38-22 at the half. The Spartans cut into the lead in the opening minutes of the second half. Hicks cut the lead to seven with a 3-pointer, but Bettencourt cut the rally short with a 3-pointer that put the lead back to double digits.
